text: HubSpot should release an embeddable code editor (something like codepen) that renders HubL. This would help share ideas in blog posts, allow for documentation, etc. <@UQERM7BLY> <@U01JV10LWGZ> <@U7SL518D6> <@UQWGKUEN7>
That would be pretty dope. I would def use that on my blog

so, it’s pretty simple for most things - i codegen’d a bunch of filters and functions on top of nunjucks - however, the difficulty is with all of the data driven bits (see: <https://github.com/kieranja/hubl>)
<@UQERM7BLY> yea, the idea is definitely inspired by what you put together. I think this incorporated into a codepen like "box" would be amazing.
I'll try to find the time to incorporate this into a <https://codesandbox.io/> embed just so that we can see what you have in action

just to confirm I get the main concept, in HTML I can write
```{{ module.variable }}```
and then in JS I include
```renderModuleString('{{ module.variable }}, { variable: 1 });```
and that value will be replace with `1` right?
i did pull the lib in via codesandbox a while ago and it worked
